abstract: Responding to Viacom’s $1 billion copyright infringement suit, Google said that it would not back off, declaring that the law was on its side.
snippet: Responding to Viacom’s $1 billion copyright infringement suit, Google said that it would not back off, declaring that the law was on its side.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., April 30 — Responding to Viacom’s $1 billion copyright infringement suit over video clips on YouTube, Google said Monday that it would not back off, declaring that the law was on its side.

headline.main: Google Calls Viacom Suit on YouTube Unfounded
headline.print_headline: Google Calls Viacom Suit On YouTube Unfounded

abstract: Microsoft has emerged as a contender to buy the online advertising firm 24/7 Real Media in an effort to stay competitive with online rivals Google and Yahoo, The New York Post reported Tuesday. Citing unnamed sources, the Post said that Microsoft is considering a bid of about $1 billion, a hefty premium over the $600 million value that analysts have given the firm.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has emerged as a contender to buy the online advertising firm 24/7 Real Media in an effort to stay competitive with online rivals Google and Yahoo, The New York Post reported Tuesday. Citing unnamed sources, the Post said that Microsoft is considering a bid of about $1 billion, a hefty premium over the $600 million value that analysts have given the firm.

headline.main: Microsoft Is Said to Consider a Bid for 24/7
